website_summaries.verdict: The best way to remove adhesive and other sticky liquid spills with little effort.
pros: Adhesive-removing formula covers many different types of sticky substances like tape and stickers
Can pour or rub the liquid on
Able to cover many sizes and surfaces
Can be used on adhesive, gum, crayon, and glue
cons: The removal liquid takes time to adequately work on most adhesives and surfaces

customer_reviews.title: WTH?
customer_reviews.text: I saw all the good reviews and went for it. I don't know what I did wrong... OK, I didn't do anything wrong, a child could use this stuff... but it didn't do anything for me. I had peeled off two dozen stickers my kids had put on our golf cart over a 20 year period, which left the adhesive still on the cart. Tried this stuff and it didn't take anything off, even with repeated applications. It simply didn't work at all.
customer_reviews.author: Bobby-Rob-Bob

customer_reviews.title: Works brilliantly
customer_reviews.text: Easily removes sticker residue. The only thing I would recommend is don't remove the silver foil at the mouth of the bottle, instead pierce the foil with a pin and then use it as a squirty bottle. This will be much easier to manage the flow of the liquid as you only need a very small amount.
customer_reviews.author: Joe90

customer_reviews.title: Use Peanut Butter Instead!
customer_reviews.text: This is not strong enough to remove residue from stickers or labels. Really disappointed. I went old school and rubbed peanut butter on what I needed to remove, waited a couple of minutes, and cleaned it off with dish soap and water. That old school method worked better than this "Goo Gone Original Liquid"! I would recommend trying the stronger version of Goo Gone, that's scented (because it smells so bad), but this is the last time I use Goo Gone on anything.
customer_reviews.author: Danny Way

customer_reviews.title: Totally Useless.
customer_reviews.text: This liquid is totally useless, it did not work for removing the decals and sticker from my camper, maybe it is good for removing the residue that is left after removing the stickers, but it does not work when it comes to removing the stickers themselfs, I tried to get a refund and I got a message saying 'This item isn't eligible for return' So I guess that they know that it does not work, otherwise it will say something like ' Money back guarantee' before you go on and purchase the product. Not honest at all!!... Sometimes buying stuff from the Internet is quite challenging!!...
customer_reviews.author: fabio a pabon

customer_reviews.title: It works on old goop too
customer_reviews.text: At least two years ago, someone ripped off knock-off command strips on the back of my bathroom door that they had used to hold up one of those cheap $5 full-body mirrors. After that long, they were yellowed, black-edged, and practically solidified into the door. This stuff took minimal elbow grease, and about 2 minutes to remove all 6 patches. I also used it to remove some dried depilating wax from a travel chest. Works well, you don't need a lot, and I highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Maite

customer_reviews.title: It works!
customer_reviews.text: It works!!.. I put some Goo gone on the tape residue... Rubbed it in with a cloth... Than took a old card I had to scrape the residue off to make things faster...
customer_reviews.author: Djeff

customer_reviews.title: I didn't think anything would get that sticker off...
customer_reviews.text: When I moved to a state that doesn't require inspection stickers on cars, I had to find something that would take it off. Because, of course, the sticker was really, really stuck on there and every attempt to pull anything off just pulled off the tiniest piece. It was still difficult when using this product, but it made a very noticeable difference. I really don't think I could have done it at all without this goo gone.
customer_reviews.author: Heather Clark

customer_reviews.title: Performed beyond expectations.
customer_reviews.text: I had purchased this in hopes of removing the residue from a "caution, tempered glass" sticker off my completely glass pc case. Not only did this remove the infuriating residue from the glass, but after a wipe down the glass was completely pristine. I would definitely recommend any pc builders use this product if you plan on refurbishing a pc case and want to get that pesky windows product key off or whatever case badges the previous owner had. Do keep in mind that the manufacturer recommends you clean off the adhesive remover with warm soapy water after using it, which I did.
customer_reviews.author: Jose

customer_reviews.title: First & Last Use of This Product
customer_reviews.text: This product is not effective at all when removing buildup and gooey substances. I attempted to use it when removing tint from windows but the residue still remained. I ended up going to the store to purchase Goof Off, which was also cheaper, and it was able to remove the tacky substance/film in minutes (see Goo Gone vs. Goof Off photos attached).
customer_reviews.author: MikeWilkes

customer_reviews.title: It's alright. Highly recommend.
customer_reviews.text: If you think you can just stick to using rubbing alcohol like I used to, worry no more! Just buy a single bottle of this miracle fluid and your life will never be the same again. I keep this in the bottom kitchen cabinet for removing those pesky low quality labels that companies still like to use for some reason. Highly recommended! No I'm not a robot. Just a really excited fellow human being who is totally not a robot. How to use: Make sure to remove as much of the sticker or residue as you can by scraping. Just dab a little bit onto a folded piece of paper towel and rub away!
customer_reviews.author: Andrew

customer_reviews.title: No squirter comes with this one
customer_reviews.text: I love goo gone and it works great. It's a great product but it's a mess if you spill it. Every other bottle I have bought has the little squirter with it so you can control the amount that comes out and it's very direct to where you want it to go. This one does not have that and when you take the cap off, it pours out and is not very convenient at all. I find I have much better luck buying name products like this at the big box store, and they are perfect there. The third party sellers that Amazon uses you never can tell what you are going to get.
customer_reviews.author: LA

customer_reviews.title: Bad packaging
customer_reviews.text: When you take the cap off, this product does not have a squeeze bottle top, it is just an empty hole. This is the 1st one I have ever received like this. Really it is useless because you often have to saturate things for it to work and without the restricted opening it makes a complete mess. Using a paper towel or cotton ball to apply just soaks up the product and enough doesn't get on to work. The bottom of the bottle is also not flat so it wobbles on the countertop making it very easy to spill.
customer_reviews.author: KMS

customer_reviews.title: This stuff works - gets the goo off
customer_reviews.text: Remove a label from a jar you want to reuse. Remove the label from almost anything. Some are tougher than others but once you've soaked it with Goo Gone the goo is GONE. the features it asked me to rate were 'adhesion' i erased that , "easy to remove" I used that but decided to interpret it my way ... and drying power - which makes even less sense than adhesion. Whoever set up this rating questionnaire obviously had no idea what Goo Gone is used for - I suggest that next time you read the product description. As for a picture...of what?
customer_reviews.author: Loretta Pirozzi

customer_reviews.title: This product really helps with certain adhesive removal.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this in order to remove the adhesive used in the attachment of the back of my Samsung Galaxy S7. I used the right tools and then used this and then alcohol to clean up the remaining adhesive so the new adhesive would stick once I finished my repair and put the new adhesive covered back on the phone. It didn't disolve the adhesive as well as some other adhesives will remove, but with some efffort it worked. I used Q tips. These adhesive removers can be a God send. Great for removing labels. Do note that on the seal there is a tiny micro seal if you just want a tiny squirt to come out.
customer_reviews.author: BubbaDooba

customer_reviews.title: Squeeze Bottle - No Longer?  Boo!  I feel cheated!
customer_reviews.text: I have used this product for many years and it always had a top with a pinhole opening so you could easily direct the liquid where you needed it. This company has made a bad decision to omit this feature. So far, I have tipped the bottle expecting to gently squeeze the liquid but instead it gushed out all over my countertop. After only using a couple of times, I have a half a bottle left whereas, formerly, a bottle would last a long time. I wonder if this company is trying to increase sales of this product? I will be looking for another source from now on. I feel cheated.
customer_reviews.author: M. A. Clark

customer_reviews.title: Amazing!
customer_reviews.text: I removed some film that a previous homeowner had stuck on the bathroom window and it left all the adhesive on the window. Nothing would remove it! I tried everyone DIY remedy I could find on the internet with no success and a lot of mess. I received the Goo Gone and left it on for a few minutes and everything scraped off with minimal effort. It got all the gunk left behind from the other remedies I tried as well. Another plus is that it doesn't have a harsh smell to it. It smells citrus-y. So happy!
customer_reviews.author: Novamom

customer_reviews.title: This worked for the stickers on the books and under the stove residue
customer_reviews.text: I've seen ads on this product but did not see the need to buy it because there are alternative methods of removing stickers from a book. I applied it to the gooey residue of the sticker on the book. Coincidentally, I was cleaning the stove and there were gooey old clear rubber residue and I used this product. It did do its job.
customer_reviews.author: The Customer

customer_reviews.title: Save Your Money
customer_reviews.text: Does this stuff work? Sort-of. Goo Gone works if you have at least an hour wait and even then a great deal of residue is left behind. Most Effective Label Remover: If you are dealing with a sticker glass or metal use heat (hair dryer, heat gun) to melt the adhesive followed by isopropyl alcohol. A quick wipe and you're all set. Obviously, do not use this technique on plastic or other malleable material.
customer_reviews.author: Physics Teacher

customer_reviews.title: Works really well!
customer_reviews.text: had a whole bunch of glass oui jars to clean off and could not for the life of me get all the residue off of them with just hot water and soap. tried this stuff and it all came off so easily! dabbed it on (a little goes a long way) and then washed all the oiliness off. I did do as someone in another review suggested - punched a hole in the silver tab instead of ripping it off. makes dispensing really easy to control. would purchase again when i i run out
customer_reviews.author: v. caldera

customer_reviews.title: Hate lables? Get this.
customer_reviews.text: Glad I found this product cuz I am a hater of labels ,especially on appliances (tacky) ... I also bought the scrapers (blue plastic ones) that are amazingly easy to work and will not ruin your nails. The product works as described , some labels are harder to remove than others ,so let the remover sit a bit .Oh ,and a little goes a long ways . I would recommend this and will buy it again . Arrived in tact and in excellent condition .
customer_reviews.author: Mothra Moth

customer_reviews.title: Absolute Garbage!
customer_reviews.text: You’d be better off using your own saliva!!! The rubber from my bathroom mat stuck to the floor. I sprayed the goo be gone and let it sit for 10 minutes as the instructions indicated. NOTHING. I tried it again and let it sit 15, then 30, 1 hour, 2 days and still nothing. Don’t waste your money or time. I never write reviews but during these uncertain times when every dollar is crucial, this would clearly be throwing money out the window. You have been warned!
customer_reviews.author: L Dubb

customer_reviews.title: Works great for removing glue ...
customer_reviews.text: BACKGROUND: Used it to remove stubborn sticker glue residue from car body & bumper; sticker was on the car at least 7 or 8 years, tried other glue removers & didn't work. 1.BUMPER: Worked like a charm on removing stubborn leftover glue from a sticker on my bumper (be careful, use soft cloth as to not scratch your paint) 2. CAR METAL BODY: had to use it twice, but worked fine. TIPS/HELP: put a few drops on the desired glue to be removed, wait a couple of minutes, use soft cloth to remove old glue, if still remains, repeat again and use more muscle in a circular motion.
customer_reviews.author: MnE

customer_reviews.title: Goo gone magic
customer_reviews.text: Always in need of this especially to clean knives, scissors and stickers with all this moving around. Does require glove protection and after use, wiping down with a damp cloth and a dry cloth to rid of goo gone residue. The pricing fluctuates so waited a few days before buying
customer_reviews.author: Director of IT

customer_reviews.title: Buy it! It works great!
customer_reviews.text: Goo Gone adhesive remover is a must-have in every household. Store & price stickers, as well as sewing and craft adhesives are impossible to remove by soaking, using a razor blade, alcohol, acetate, etc. Goo Gone does a perfect job & doesn't cause damage like acetate or razors. You will need to wash off the oily residue with water or glass cleaner. Nothing works as great as Goo Gone! Love it! It was well package for shipping!
customer_reviews.author: M Krenz

customer_reviews.title: It works!!
customer_reviews.text: My wife thought she ruined her new pair of yoga pants when she got a huge blob of chewing gum on them. We tried freezing the gum and scraping it off but it did nothing, we tried heating it up and picking pieces off but that made more of a mess. We purchased the Goo Gone and applied it as per the directions and it dissolved the gum instantly. A light second application total cleaned the fabric. After a quick wash the pants were as good as new.
customer_reviews.author: Paul C

customer_reviews.title: Does the job beautifully
customer_reviews.text: My only issue with Goo Gone is the unpleasant odor that lingers for a day or so when I use it to remove price stickers from LP covers. But the odor does go away, and a little inconvenience beats torn jackets and/or leftover sticky residue. Instantly removes grease pencil marks, too. I used to use lighter fluid for the same purposes, but Goo Gone is obviously the better option. Recommneded.
customer_reviews.author: Lee Hartsfeld

customer_reviews.title: Woooow...
customer_reviews.text: This stuff is the real deal. :o Full-lace-wig glue. Gone. Stickers on the floor. Gone. Weird, questionable messes on tables and floors that have mysterious origins and even more mysterious contents. Gone. I don't know what they put in this stuff other than orange oil, but my goodness... I am so relieved to have this bottle in my home. :o
customer_reviews.author: Rashida

customer_reviews.title: An incredibly awesome product
customer_reviews.text: Always have loved Goo Gone. My Dad used to use it when we were growing up to remove an array of different things that were usually hard to remove, mostly sticky residue from stickers or price tags. I still use it to this day and just ordered some more. It effortlessly with as little as a napkin or paper towel removes stubborn adhesive or residue and cleans quickly cutting through all sorts of things. Very impressed as always.
customer_reviews.author: Arok5

customer_reviews.title: Highly Effective
customer_reviews.text: I've used this product for decades at home and at work, and I've found it highly effective! Make sure you take care to store this product out of reach of children and pets. Also, since this product is highly effective, it's best to squirt it onto a soft, clean cloth or onto a cotton ball before you apply it onto a gooey surface. This product works best if you do your best to remove any sticker from the surface, then apply this product as needed, then wash off the product's slightly greasy residue with gentle soap and water.
customer_reviews.author: 21st Century Girl

customer_reviews.title: Easily Removes the Goo!
customer_reviews.text: Goo Gone is the best adhesive remover that I've found. Just a tiny bit on a paper towel will take off stuck-on goo effortlessly. I find it particularly useful for removing the baked-on goo found on car windshields when an old sticker is razored off. The product's smell is pleasant, and it washes off hands easily. Goo Gone is an essential to keep around the house or workshop.
customer_reviews.author: R. Klein

customer_reviews.title: Great Product, but...
customer_reviews.text: I always reach for Goo-B-Gone when removing sticky substances. I like the fresh citrus smell. And with a bit of elbow grease, any adhesive residue will come off. I've been taking the labels off of old prescription bottles and donating them back to my local area vet clinic. However, In the past, the previous bottle had a stopper of some sort in the opening. It prevents overpouring. What happened to it? I found that do-hicky very helpful.
customer_reviews.author: Kimberly C.

customer_reviews.title: great stuff
customer_reviews.text: I had some serious residue from a spice organizer in one of my apartment cabinets (not wood) and this stuff zapped it! I was worried we'd be charged for damage if I couldn't get it off, but now you can't even tell anything was there. I did have to let it sit for a while, but that was fine with me. Highly recommend if you need to remove sticky reside left behind from wall hangers etc.
customer_reviews.author: Sue

customer_reviews.title: Rating good but recommendation
customer_reviews.text: I have loved Goo Gone for many years. However, now that I am an elderly arthritic person, opening the cap was very difficult. I wish a just twist screw cap were included so once product is home, the buyer can substitute original cap and make opening easier. The bottle before this one was big and I ended up having to punch a hole in the bottle and used masking tape to cover the hole when not in use. I was hoping the smaller bottle would prove easier and it did; just not easy. :)
customer_reviews.author: Leslie G.

customer_reviews.title: Goo Gone is great, especially for removing stubborn stickers on packages
customer_reviews.text: Goo Gone is great, especially for removing stubborn stickers on packages. I had a plastic container I wanted to remove a sticker from. I applied some Goo Gone and let us sit for about 15 minutes. I went to wipe the sticker away away with a paper towel and it slid right off, leaving no residue. Definitely a must have household product. As a note, sometimes it won’t fully remove if you leave it on for about 5 minutes if the sticker is stubborn. I’d recommend leaving it on longer. I’ve sometimes even left it on for about a half hour and everything will wipe away clean. I’d especially recommend doing this for plastic surfaces that won’t be damaged.
customer_reviews.author: Gina G.

customer_reviews.title: It works and removes glue residue on hard surfaces from stickers and price tags
customer_reviews.text: This is the best product for removing glue residue from glass or solid surfaces that I have ever used. The only thing I don't like about it are the fumes---it has a petrochemical smell when you are applying it---I suggest you have adequate ventilation in the room where you are using it esp. if you have a large surface with glue residue you are trying to remove.
customer_reviews.author: VickyNC

customer_reviews.title: Ineffective, streaky, and inelligble for return
customer_reviews.text: I really wanted to like this product. I trusted other reviews but when it came to removing adhesive residue, it didn't work (yes I let it sit) and left a super streaky residue that was hard to get off in and of itself. Furthermore, Amazon won't let me return this item at all, so I'm out the money for a product I'll never use again because it doesn't work.
customer_reviews.author: T. G. Cline

customer_reviews.title: Still the best
customer_reviews.text: I had used goo gone about 15 years ago. I need to remove some stickers. The first thing that came to my mind was goo gone. It is one of the few products that removes the sticky parts of stickers with no issues. I have used it in the past to remove gum from my jeep wranglers carpet. It works like a charm then and still today. Just make sure you look at the surfaces it works on.
customer_reviews.author: dan

customer_reviews.title: Really works well on tough sticker mess
customer_reviews.text: I had some industrial strength stickers on my toilet lids that I could not for the life of me remove either by a) using cleaners or b) carefully scraping, even with a razor edge. Goo gone wiped these unsightly sticker stains off in 1 second of use. VERY IMPRESSIVE. It also worked at loosening some spilled paint marks and a marker pen on white surface.
customer_reviews.author: Gt

customer_reviews.title: Ridiculously hard labels I couldn't remove
customer_reviews.text: ... Until now. Wow. Just got this yesterday. I keep tea tins and glass bottles and all of them with previous labels. Some, I had given up on many of them after soaking them for days and tried whatever other tricks people have suggested. This worked. Every one of those labels came off within minutes. Yes, just like that.
customer_reviews.author: K433Top Contributor: Pets

customer_reviews.title: With patience and rubbing, It works !
customer_reviews.text: I've had one opportunity to try his product upon it's arrival> I's o.k., but if the gummed labels being removed have been in place for a long time(perhaps over 1 or 2 years), then a little bit of elbow grease is needed to remove) one application, alternating with rubbing perhaps 4 or 5 times will get the job done. My point is'"don't expect 1 application, and the label will drop off, because it won't. An application of lacquer thinner or alcohol will work just about as well as this product, however using this product is safer. I'm satisfied with "Goo Gone"
customer_reviews.author: gejome

customer_reviews.title: Works well.
customer_reviews.text: Actually works very well. So far perfect for Kids stickers on clothes that went through the wash and I though had permeant sticker gue on them. This took it off without any effort and did not stain clothes (cotton). Takes a bit more effort to for stickers on glass, but worked better than other methods I've tried. Very easy to use for plastics. A little goes a long way. Would/will purchase again if I ever run out. :)
customer_reviews.author: Lisa Marney

customer_reviews.title: Works great.
customer_reviews.text: This product does just what it says it will do. I get audiobooks that have been withdrawn from the Library - this takes off all the stuck on papers, pockets, etc... and then the cd holder - which is a nice plastic - looks brand new - Originally they are a $50 investment - and I get them for a dime...not bad...I give them out to people who love to read - but can no longer see to do so or people who are trying to improve their English and need to listen to well-spoken pronunciation.
customer_reviews.author: Mary A.

customer_reviews.title: Took sticky, tarry mystery mess off of new floors
customer_reviews.text: I'm not sure what the stuff was but it was sticky, black and resistant to removal. Dollops of the mess was all over my brand-new classroom floors. Squirted some Goo Gone on them, waited a minute, commenced to scrubbing with scrubbie and off it all came. I will warn though, even when operating out of the pinhole in the foil a LOT comes out and not necessarily in the direction you point. I wasted a lot but that's okay. I can stop worrying about the next time the building super walks in.
customer_reviews.author: sherri perry

customer_reviews.title: fantastic at removing gunk!
customer_reviews.text: I use it frequently to remove ultra-sticky labels from second-hand electronics & video games, and to remove other sticky gunk from them. Just a few drops goes a long ways, allowing me to restore these devices to their retro glory. Even new item price tags and labels can be hard to remove, sometimes leaving behind a messy residue, and without this stuff sometimes they get damaged trying to scrape the gunk off. With a drop or two of Goo Gone and letting it sit for a bit, this stuff always comes off extremely easily without marring the surface. One bottle lasts a long time.
customer_reviews.author: DC

customer_reviews.title: Goo Gone Adhesive Remover - 8 Ounce - WORKS!
customer_reviews.text: Goo Gone Adhesive Remover - 8 Ounce - works great... I bought this originally to try and remove labels from a collection of storage bins I bought for assorted hardware. I first used a heat gun to soften the glue to get most of the label off but then I was still left with the residual glue, Goo Gone got it all off... Thank you!
customer_reviews.author: Raa

customer_reviews.title: Didn't remove my tape residue
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to remove tape residue from our outside door. During winter I put up a sign on the door using tape. I took the sign down and tape residue stayed on the door. I used this product and left it on like it said, and it didn't remove the problem.
customer_reviews.author: Mary W

customer_reviews.title: Removes Sticky Things Like a Charm
customer_reviews.text: I use this very frequently. Tricky price sticker? Goo Gone. Miscellaneous sticker stuck to something? Goo Gone. Mysterious sticky residue? Goo Gone. It does take a little elbow grease, but its the best thing I've used to get adhesive off of things. The only problem I have is that sometimes I use a little too much and it leaves a slightly oily residue on whatever I was using it on.
customer_reviews.author: Nina E

customer_reviews.title: Works like a charm
customer_reviews.text: Got a new picture frame with the price sticker right on the glass? This works. Got kids who like to stick their stickers everywhere? This works. New car come with labels all over the windows? This works. Basically anything that has residue from adhesive can benefit from this stuff, I love it. Seems there are always new places I find to use it. Highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: AJ

customer_reviews.title: Goo Gone is good but this bottle sucks
customer_reviews.text: OK. I love Goo Gone the product but I really didn’t like this bottle. It is just an open bottle top, no cover with a small hole, no squirt mechanism so on first to use just wanting to pour a little bit on a sticker to remove it I wasted a quarter of the bottle. That’s my only complaint; perhaps I didn’t read the product description well enough if it was there. I like Goo Gone with some sort of a regulatory dispenser.
customer_reviews.author: T. S. Rock

customer_reviews.title: Same old, same old
customer_reviews.text: This stuff is no different from any other adhesive remover. It was recommended to remove address labels/stickers from vinyl record labels. After using as instructed, It didn't do anything to soften or loosen the paper -- in fact, it left an oil stain that never completely disappeared. Save your money and frustration! Also, not happy that I couldn't return this to the seller for a refund...
customer_reviews.author: in-tegrity

customer_reviews.title: One of the best products ever
customer_reviews.text: I know the title is a bit much but man I hate adhesive stickers and this stuff removes it off with no problems. I'm mad that I didn't find this sooner. If you have stickers on your game cases from used game stores or you have stickers on your Tupperware get it off in an instant with this. I'd love to be the ambassador for this product!
customer_reviews.author: Rod Joseph

customer_reviews.title: What can one say?
customer_reviews.text: "Goo Gone" is Goo Gone... it just does it's thing - have been using it for I can't tell you how many years! Takes off just about any kind of residue you can think of in the Automotive field anyway... love it!
customer_reviews.author: James D.

customer_reviews.title: Let it sit and it will do the work
customer_reviews.text: I soak a paper towel in Goo Gone and let it sit on top of whatever is sticky. In a few minutes, it wipes away like magic. Let it sit for a bit and it will do the work
customer_reviews.author: Geoff Maddocks

customer_reviews.title: works
customer_reviews.text: it works! It'll leave an oily residue so if you're working with less absorbent materials (plastics/glass) this will be fine. I've tried it on notebooks in the past and it definitely leaves an oil stain, would just keep that in mind.
customer_reviews.author: Tori

customer_reviews.title: Great product
customer_reviews.text: This product does what it was made for perfectly. This product can be used with any plastic with stickers as I used this on 2 Wiitars I had bought recently that had a bunch of stickers on it and I wanted a clean look on it. I took off the plate on the Wiitar and applied drops of the Goo Gone and let it rest and soak in for around 5 or more minutes. I then got some paper towels and dowsed it in Hot water and rubbed the sticker off. after that I used two more dry paper towels to remove the left over debris and to remove the remaining Goo Gone which feels like oil.
customer_reviews.author: Jose E Fuentes

customer_reviews.title: Good product
customer_reviews.text: Worked very well on old adhesive tape on glass. I had to use three applications and my fingernails to get the old glue off then clean up the residue with Windex but this product worked for me as it has in the past. This time I purchased this larger sizer because I use it quite often. Works well on painted car surfaces.
customer_reviews.author: C. Potter

customer_reviews.title: Probably great in general, but didn't work for me.
customer_reviews.text: Two stars because it didn't work for my specific case. If I had a different use case, I might have had a better outcome. I have a guitar speaker cabinet where the manufacturer's nameplate was glued onto the grill cloth. The nameplate is long gone, and I've got a big thick wad of glue that I'd love to get rid of. I've tried putting plenty of it on and leaving it to soak into the glue, and tried putting some on a cloth and applying lots of elbow grease. Nothing worked.
customer_reviews.author: RH

customer_reviews.title: Indispensable product in my home and yard
customer_reviews.text: We have fabulous looking euforbias that come up every spring and are amazing tall and a lovely lime green bloom (sort of like a hydrangia). The problem is that when the blooming stalks turn brown and dry out you have to cut them off at the base of the plant. This causes an awful blue sticky goo to coat your clippers, sometimes your arms and if it drips on the driveway, makes a stain. For years we've tried everything, and a couple years ago one of our adult children suggested goo gone. It is the only product that removes this awful sticky substance easily from skin, pavers, and sheers. Thank you for your prouduct. Homeowner in Orinda California
customer_reviews.author: Candace Denman

customer_reviews.title: Great product
customer_reviews.text: As a greeting card maker, there are times when my table gets sticky. This is the only thing that gets it off. I also use it on scotch tape that otherwise won’t come off. When one bottle gets low, I purchase another one. I’m never with out it.
customer_reviews.author: Patricia M. Gonsalves

customer_reviews.title: AMAZING!!!
customer_reviews.text: This stuff is AMAZING!!! I got body stuck to my bathtub & I tried EVERYTHING to removing - I was scrubbing for weeks. I cam across this on a "Bustle" article and I am so glad. I let this sit on the wax for 5-10 minutes and it wiped right off. Amazing. Couldn't be happier with this product!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Its GooGone
customer_reviews.text: I have used this stuff for years and years. Always have some on hand. Still works good, but not as well as what they made 20 years ago. Still does the job though. Seems like the early stuff worked better or the stuff Im trying to remove now days is just stucky better. lol
customer_reviews.author: Bug

customer_reviews.title: Did the job!!  Coated knobs on a amplifier became sticky ..........needed help!
customer_reviews.text: I read a review for this product so I ordered a small bottle. It worked great! I used a Que Tip to start but when I removed the 32 knobs from the amp/mixer I put them in a small container with some of this remover. It only took about 5 minutes and they were like new. Highly recommend!
customer_reviews.author: W. Kiesewetter

customer_reviews.title: Still the best for removing 'goo'
customer_reviews.text: Best product for removing old glue and other sticky gunk. Test on an unexposed surface if you are not certain it will work. I use old rags and gloves when I apply this. It was the only thing that would get fly paper glue off window glass. It is citrus scented so it will not stink up the place. I discovered this brand years ago when I was cleaning up a house to prep for sale. Glad it is still around.
customer_reviews.author: SRKTop Contributor: Pets

customer_reviews.title: Always a good choice.
customer_reviews.text: This has always been a go to when it comes to sticky messes. This time I needed it on my kitchen counter that I covered with clear stick on shelf liner. (It's make tile but the grout work was poor so it would collect crumbs and such) I was able to get all of it off with little effort. (Gonna put in a mix together adhesive stuff to even it to an all the way flat surface... no more grout wells!
customer_reviews.author: Bridgette

customer_reviews.title: Nothing better for sticky messes!
customer_reviews.text: This stuff is magic. One of my biggest pet peeves is the sticky residue left behind by various product stickers (among life's other sticky messes). Goo Gone gets rid of sticky residue super easily and it's a staple in my cleaning closet. Like most people, I rely on honest product reviews to make purchase decisions. Because the experience of others has been so helpful to me, I try to provide honest, helpful reviews to assist other shoppers in selecting the right products for them. I hope my review has been helpful to you!
customer_reviews.author: Bria J

customer_reviews.title: Great Buy!
customer_reviews.text: My boyfriend bought this using my account. He just told me to leave a 5 star review after cleaning this old printer his mom gave him. He NEVER writes reviews but knows I do (lol) so he made sure to tell me to write one, which means this product must be amazing. He says it works great on hard plastic. The printer was greasy and old looking, now it looks brand new with literally a full bottle of product left. Great buy, it was well worth the money!
customer_reviews.author: raiinaa whyte

customer_reviews.title: Great for DVD/Blu-ray case sticker removal
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to get rid of the egregious residue left after trying to pull those annoying stickers from the cardboard sleeves of DVD/Blu-ray cases. I was concerned it might discolor, or otherwise ruin the cardboard sleeves, but it's amazing; strips the residue off with ease and leaves the sleeves and cases perfectly clean. Very happy with this product.
customer_reviews.author: E. Nash

customer_reviews.title: Doesn’t remove stickers
customer_reviews.text: Based on the description I thought this product could remove a sticker from a window. Turns out it only removes the sticky stuff when you spend a while removing the sticker with a razor blade. Would have returned it, if returns were allowable, but they are not.
customer_reviews.author: Andrew K. Benitez

customer_reviews.title: Beats anything else
customer_reviews.text: I reuse jars, especially now for pandemic preparedness and find it so annoying when i cant remove all the adhesive strips that hold the paper label. No longer! This works - squirt it on and wait a minute and then i use a scrubby and the jar is clear again! Pricy but worth it.
customer_reviews.author: subsmom

customer_reviews.title: It’s pretty gross I’ve had to remove as much goo as ...
customer_reviews.text: I’ve bought a few of these things over the years. Help get hard to remove stickers off of things and it gets rid of most kinds of goo off of stuff. It’s pretty gross I’ve had to remove as much goo as I have had to remove off of stuff in my life. Half the time I’m not even sure what it is, I’m just glad to know that I have goo be gone in my life.
customer_reviews.author: HonestFeedback

customer_reviews.title: and you only have to use a little -Natural -Smells great -Easy to pour Cons -Greasy on surface
customer_reviews.text: We bought this after I got a piece of gum stuck to my shirt and pillow case. We looked up different ways to get gum out and everything we tried didn't work, so we tried this. It look just about 30 seconds of scrubbing the fabric and the gum came right out. We also used it on a sticker that got stuck to our side table, which took it right off. Pros -Big bottle, and you only have to use a little -Natural -Smells great -Easy to pour Cons -Greasy on surface, but it comes off easily with a little water
customer_reviews.author: Chris

customer_reviews.title: For labels, stickers & other Goo - Gone!
customer_reviews.text: I bought GooGone to get rid of stubborn wine labels that were mostly Goo. After soaking & scrubbing for days, the GooGone erased it in minutes. You know those clear round pads that act like noise-bumpers for cabinet doors? They turn to goo & get you sticky if you touch it. A little GooGone & that Goo is Gone!
customer_reviews.author: Leslie Burch

customer_reviews.title: Good adhesive remover
customer_reviews.text: Works well to remove sticker residue. The citrus scent smells artificial and isn't very pleasant. However, it does what it's supposed to do, which is remove the goop left by unwanted labels and stickers. I've used this product on glass and staineless steel, and so far, I'm very happy with my purchase.
customer_reviews.author: AKN

customer_reviews.title: Goo? Gone!
customer_reviews.text: Don’t need much at all and easily got rid of residue in seconds! I used it on a vest (black, weather resistant material) I had that went though the wash with a sticker on it and I thought the goo would never come off. Not only did it come off, but it left no residue, smell, or discoloration behind! This bottle will last me forever; great value. I’ll have to try it on other things to really see its range, of course, but it saved my favorite vest, which made me a believer!
customer_reviews.author: B

customer_reviews.title: Love this stuff
customer_reviews.text: Love this stuff. It absolutely does the job. You know when you buy a mirror and there is that terrible sticky residue from the sticker? This will get it off. Now don't expect it to be easy. You absolutely do need to put some elbow grease into it but it does work. Make sure you take a wet cloth and wipe after or it will get oily.
customer_reviews.author: Savannah

customer_reviews.title: Removes Adhesive Easily
customer_reviews.text: Recently, I have been trying to reuse items to use as decorations. I love turning bottles into lights, but some bottle's do not have "pretty" stickers on them. Sometimes, you don't want to advertise as a form of decorating! I bought this Goo Gone Adhesive Remover to remove the adhesive off of wine bottles. With this product, the adhesive nearly SLID OFF! It was a little messy and slippery, but after washing and drying the bottle, it was as good as new. I would definitely recommend this item for DIY-ers or anyone else who may need to remove adhesive off of any type of surface.
customer_reviews.author: klb

customer_reviews.title: Best adhesive remover on the market, hands down
customer_reviews.text: Been using Goo Gone for years, it is the only product I have found that effortlessly eats through adhesives, tapes and glues. Even does well getting out tree sap too! Don't even bother using another product, this is exactly what you need.
customer_reviews.author: M. Myers

customer_reviews.title: Works like a charm
customer_reviews.text: Goo Gone delivers. After trying countless other solvents and every known DIY concoction for removing labels, I ordered Goo Gone and my sticky problems are gone. Well worth the price!
customer_reviews.author: StudioTanaka

customer_reviews.title: Works on Plastidip.... Amazed..!!
customer_reviews.text: I wasn't expecting much of this product... I wanted to remove some old Plastidip on my front grill... OMG...!! It works like magic.. just apply and wait 3 - 4 min.. then appliy it to any microfiber cloth and start rubbing... Plastidip just fell off from my car like magic.
customer_reviews.author: Jorge M.

customer_reviews.title: Great stuff..easy to use and works great.
customer_reviews.text: If I had any complaint it would be that I only used a small fraction of the bottle. A little does a great job. Had one of those large energy efficient stickers on my washing machine. I used maybe an ounce from the bottle. Couple paper towels and that was it. I tried a couple other things first and it wasn't coming off...maybe 10 minutes of elbow grease and Goo Gone and there was zero sticker left.
customer_reviews.author: James Wohler

customer_reviews.title: Greasy, but gets the job done.
customer_reviews.text: Kind of leaves the surface of the item you're trying to remove something sticky from greasy but it can be wiped of quickly with a dry paper towel. But overall it works and has a pleasant smell to it.
customer_reviews.author: Quan

customer_reviews.title: Silly Putty on Wool sweater
customer_reviews.text: I had this stress reliever putty bright green(basically goo that you squish your hand into) from the early 20's, anyways had no clue what it was made of and it would not come off a dark blue wool sweater. UNTIL GOO GONE, also totally got gum on my sisters pants years ago and my mom saved my life with this product, so thank you goo gone, I owe you my teenage life. Over all, this product is fabulous and if you need to get something like gum or silly putty off clothing it will do the trick!
customer_reviews.author: caitlin desmet

customer_reviews.title: WoW!!!
customer_reviews.text: This product works so well, is easy to use, and you don't need very much to remove the adhesive. I put it on a paper towel and rub a short time, and wa-la! It's gone. Washes off easily. Smell is much better than the lighter fluid I have used in the past.
customer_reviews.author: Zooms

customer_reviews.title: work almost well
customer_reviews.text: this works better than rubbing alcohol. i am trying to remove adhesive left on my motor home from a strip of velcro. it takes my applications and lots of rubbing. if it was a jelly that would stay on the adhesive for a period of time, it my work better.
customer_reviews.author: Steven Dunn

customer_reviews.title: It Doesn't Work On Everything But Still A Good Product
customer_reviews.text: I tried this on a cordless rubber drill handle that had developed a sticky residue on it. Goo Gone didn't do much at all and required a very liberal amount of the product to remove any of the gunk. Maybe an unfair test of the product but it is not a 100% cure all for any type of sticky substance.
customer_reviews.author: William R. Paxton

customer_reviews.title: Highly recommend!
customer_reviews.text: Amazing!! I got this to get the remnants of a sticker off my Macbook and I was blown away. I had tried everything else and Goo Gone took it off in a few seconds. Great product to keep around the house. Highly recommend!!
customer_reviews.author: Lisa

customer_reviews.title: Works Exactly as Advertised
customer_reviews.text: This is the first product that I have purchased in a long time that does exactly what it says. I needed to clean up the sticky residue left by carpet tape on a tile floor. A scraper was taking forever. Got the Goo Gone and was amazed. I just wiped it on the glue and wiped it all off. Amazing! Also worked to take tape residue off wooden fireplace front. I had actually given up on that ever coming off. Wonderful product.
customer_reviews.author: Shirley Resnick

customer_reviews.title: Does exactly what it says it does... removes goo!
customer_reviews.text: Goo Gone does exactly what it’s name says, it removes goo. It removed my old, faded bumper stickers on my car with no problem, and no damage to the car. It will remove gum from hair or carpet or clothing like soap removes dirt. It is amazing, and I️ love the stuff. I️ just Have a difficult time finding it in the store.
customer_reviews.author: rn4kids

customer_reviews.title: Works great.  I've been using this product for 30+ years
customer_reviews.text: If you have any adhesive left behind from stickers, labels or anything this product will remove it! I've been using it for over 30 years and it's never disappointed me.
customer_reviews.author: Peter from Clearwater

customer_reviews.title: "And the winner is".......
customer_reviews.text: After going 12 rounds with a sticker on my new air fryer, I gave up. I ordered my new bottle of Goo Gone, and guess who won? Should have known better.....this is the best for removing anything sticky. I highly recommend having this on hand for ANYTHING> love it!
customer_reviews.author: M L in Phoenix

customer_reviews.title: Rug Saver
customer_reviews.text: Removed some years old thick sticky gunk on wool braid rug. Just squirt it on and wait 15 minutes. Seemed to disolve the matter on the rug. Works in removing tape glue on plastic and glass, but is a far bigger mess and cleanup. Every household needs this.
customer_reviews.author: Cimmay

customer_reviews.title: Good Goo
customer_reviews.text: Hey, it does what it's meant to do -- remove goo. It won't be all goo but mostly any goo you might encounter. Unfortunately, they cheapened the dispenser (surprised?). Still, the stuff works in most practical scenarios.
customer_reviews.author: Andrew

customer_reviews.title: Time Saver
customer_reviews.text: Goo Gone removes all sticky residues. It has removed multiple stickers from our children’s play sets, glass, and even our freezer. It is convenient and easy to use and it saves me time cleaning. It also works on getting off the adhesive on water bottles where the label sticker used to be.
customer_reviews.author: KALH

customer_reviews.title: Handy stuff
customer_reviews.text: A bottle of this stuff can last quite a while. Over the years, I have used it to remove crayons from walls, adhesive residue, paint from clothes, quite a variety of things. Not good on rugs. May take the color out.
customer_reviews.author: Milo Wadlin

customer_reviews.title: Works great!
customer_reviews.text: Cleaning the labels off of 100 wine bottles and just couldn’t get the last of that sticky off! Goo Gone was recommended and I wish I had known sooner. Easily removed that stubborn goo leaving me with sparkling like new wine bottles for my home made blackberry wine! I am a happy camper!
customer_reviews.author: Renee

customer_reviews.title: Miracle Product
customer_reviews.text: Great product!! My beautiful walnut desk was severely damaged by a disintegrating desk blotter....unbeknownst to me! When I finally saw the severely stuck on mess it left behind, I was beyond upset. After using one application of Goo Gone Adhesive Remover...and a bit of “elbow grease”..... 80% of the mess was gone!!! I was delighted!!! I will apply a second application soon. But my beautiful desk was saved!!
customer_reviews.author: Susan G.

customer_reviews.title: Love this stuff
customer_reviews.text: I keep some jars for different reasons and I soak it in hot water then take off the label. What’s left is the sticky glue so I take a paper towel, put some goo gone on it and rub the glue off. I love this stuff!
customer_reviews.author: Elizabeth

customer_reviews.title: Goo Gone is awesome!!!
customer_reviews.text: I knew what I was getting when I ordered the Goo Gone.. I use this product, and I love it. I couldn't find it at any of the local stores where I shop, so the next best place was Amazon. It was delivered in record time. I use this to clean up sticky sticker messes on products that sticker glue won't come off of with soap and water, and it's great for removing the residue of inspection and registration stickers. It takes gum off of shoes, and takes care of other sticky messes that can't be cleaned up using household cleaner or soap and water.
customer_reviews.author: Nani

customer_reviews.title: This stuff is pretty tame. I was used to using stuff like ...
customer_reviews.text: This stuff is pretty tame. I was used to using stuff like the extra strong Goof Off (the really flammable stuff), which I thought works a bit better for removing stuff like label glue from jars and whatnot. If you are working with stuff like glass or metal, go with the powerful stuff. If you're working on anything that might get messed up from the hard stuff, go with this.
customer_reviews.author: dc

customer_reviews.title: I got this because I got a nice sized goop of Bicylce grease right on my favorite ...
customer_reviews.text: I got this because I got a nice sized goop of Bicylce grease right on my favorite jeans. I followed the instructions perfectly the first time, and it didn't do anything. Very disappointing. However, I then tried it with the upholstery instructions (wash under sink then scrub in goo gone with brush) and it worked fine. Even though it took me two tries, I was amazed! I wasn't very hopeful about it working at all from the getgo, so this was an awesome surprise. So don't be discouraged if it doesn't do the trick via washing machine. Just give it a try with the brush.
customer_reviews.author: Matty

product_meta.title: Goo Gone Adhesive Remover - 8 Ounce - Surface Safe Adhesive Remover Safely Removes Stickers Labels Decals Residue Tape Chewing Gum Grease Tar
product_meta.description: Package Quantity:1The Goo Gone's line of products is a trusted brand, we stand by our products for all of your dirty, sticky, messes. Safe for you, your surfaces and your home! Please explore our line of Goo Gone Original, Pro-Power, All Purpose, Sticker Lifter, Spray Gel, Patio, Grill, Oven, Automotive, Tile & Grout, Clean Up Wipes, Kitchen Degreasers, Paint and more! There are so many ways to remove tough messes with Goo Gone Products. Specifically formulated with Citrus Power, Goo Gone’s portfolio of products effortlessly cleans up stains and sticky messes around your entire home. From gum to grease, fabric to fiberglass, you can count on Goo Gone to safely remove almost any problem and restore your surfaces to their original condition. If you can’t undo it, un-goo it. Remove sticky, greasy messes with Goo Gone Original and return your surfaces to their original condition. Try it on stickers, wax, markers, crayons, glue, tar, window decals, glitter, gum, labels and so much more. There are mutliple uses around the house for Goo Gone Original. Everything from wine glass label remover, scuff eraser, window sill cleaner, adhesive remover, tar cleaner, crayon drawing eraser, to glue remover. Goo Gone is safe on cars, we suggest to test on an inconspicuous area before using it in full. After you’re done, wash the area with hot, soapy water. Do not allow Goo Gone Original to sit on rubber as it can deteriorate it. Keep a bottle or two handy for anything life may throw at you or your walls, floors, cars, etc. You get it, Goo Gone is surface safe so it is a safe alternative to abrasive cleaners that may damage your surfaces. Sit back and let Goo Gone take care of your toughest messes.
feature_bullets: Safely Restore Your Surfaces - The surface-safe formula removes the goo without harming your surface. Formulated with citrus cleaning agents and a pleasant citrus scent
Trusted #1 Brand For Removing Gooey Messes – Try it on stickers, wax, markers, crayons, glue, tar, window decals, glitter, gum, labels and so much more
Multiple Uses Around The House – Everything from wine glass label remover, scuff eraser, window sill cleaner, adhesive remover, tar cleaner, crayon drawing eraser, to glue remover
Great For Teachers and Parents - Use this to remove gum, tape, crayon and sticker residue left behind by kids
Perfect For Collectors and Thrifters - Safely remove price stickers from gifts, wine glasses, clothing, drinking glasses, used video games and much more
